titles.title: American Flag Pride Act
American Flag Pride Act
To amend title 5, United States Code, to ensure that the right of Federal employees to display the flag of the United States not be abridged.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.
Mr. Armey asked unanimous consent to discharge from committee and consider.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 10/16/2002--Passed House without amendment. American Flag Pride Act - Prohibits any Government agency, officer, or other authority from adopting or enforcing any policy or entering into any agreement that would restrict or prevent a Federal employee from displaying the U.S. flag or a U.S. flag pin on his or her person, in his or her workplace, or on a Government vehicle operated by such employee.
